result.execSummary:
The defendant Monique M Betts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs due by payment plan of $50 a month beginning 1/1/16. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25 owed with that time to run consecutive to any other jail time.
Submit to DNA sample and pay $200 surcharge.

Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Consecutive to: Sheboygan Co. cases 14CM903 & 14CM483
